body: VoltAI is a Series A semiconductor AI startup that raised $36M from <SmartLink id='sequoia'>Sequoia Capital</SmartLink>.
The team includes <SmartLink id='olympiad-talent'>IOI/IPhO medalists</SmartLink> and ex-Synopsys leadership focused on reasoning models for verification.

deepDives.title: Why Sequoia Invested
deepDives.content: Sequoia's thesis: AI-first semiconductor tools can 10x designer productivity by automating DRC/LVS verification. VoltAI is shipping reasoning models that reduce false positives and shorten tape-out cycles.

sequoia.summary: Sequoia Capital is a VC firm with $85B AUM; backs category-defining companies.

olympiad-talent.summary: International Olympiad medalists represent top 0.01% of global technical talent.

body: NodeBench AI's reasoning models for <SmartLink id='drc-verification'>DRC/LVS verification</SmartLink> align with VoltAI's roadmap.
Expected ROI: 8x speedup in verification time and $2M/year cost savings per enterprise customer.

deepDives.title: Technical Integration Path
deepDives.content: RESTful API integration: VoltAI sends GDSII files, NodeBench returns constraint violations with confidence scores. Latency target: <500ms for 1M transistor designs.

drc-verification.summary: Design Rule Check (DRC) and Layout vs Schematic (LVS) are critical verification steps; current heuristic tools see high false positive rates.
